Payback (2023)

Payback was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by WWE that took place on September 2, 2023, at the PPG Paints Arena in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. It was the 12th event in the Payback chronology and featured wrestlers from the Raw and SmackDown brands.

# Production

## Background

Payback was first announced in July 2023, with the PPG Paints Arena in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, being revealed as the host venue. Tickets for the event went on sale on July 14, 2023. The event was made available for viewing on the WWE Network, as well as on traditional PPV outlets.

## Storylines

The road to Payback began in the aftermath of SummerSlam, where several rivalries and storylines started to unfold. On the Raw brand, a rivalry between WWE Champion Seth Rollins and Finn Bálor began to intensify, with the two superstars engaging in a series of intense matches and promos. Meanwhile, on the SmackDown brand, a feud between Universal Champion Roman Reigns and Sami Zayn started to gain momentum.

# Event

## Pre-show

The Payback pre-show kicked off with a match between the team of Drew Gulak and Kevin Owens and the team of The Viking Raiders. The match saw Gulak and Owens emerge victorious, with Gulak pinning Erik after a vicious clothesline.

## Preliminary matches

The first match of the main card saw Becky Lynch take on Bayley in a highly anticipated bout. The match saw Lynch emerge victorious, pinning Bayley after a Manhandle Slam. The next match saw the team of The Usos take on the team of The New Day, with The Usos emerging victorious after a series of high-flying maneuvers.

## Main event

The main event of the evening saw WWE Champion Seth Rollins take on Finn Bálor in a highly anticipated match. The match saw both superstars engage in a series of intense and hard-hitting maneuvers, with Rollins eventually emerging victorious after a Curb Stomp.

# Reception

Payback received generally positive reviews from critics and fans alike. Many praised the event's strong in-ring action, as well as the intense and dramatic storylines that unfolded throughout the evening.

# Aftermath

## Raw

The night after Payback, on Raw, Seth Rollins celebrated his successful title defense against Finn Bálor. However, his celebration was short-lived, as he was confronted by a returning Braun Strowman, who challenged Rollins to a match for the WWE Championship.

## SmackDown

On SmackDown, Roman Reigns celebrated his successful title defense against Sami Zayn. However, his celebration was interrupted by a returning Brock Lesnar, who challenged Reigns to a match for the Universal Championship.

# Results

* Drew Gulak and Kevin Owens defeated The Viking Raiders (Pre-show)
* Becky Lynch defeated Bayley
* The Usos defeated The New Day
* Seth Rollins defeated Finn Bálor to retain the WWE Championship

# External links

* Official Payback 2023 website
* WWE Payback 2023 on WWE Network

article:
Knock at the Cabin

Knock at the Cabin is a 2023 American apocalyptic psychological horror film written and directed by M. Night Shyamalan. The film is based on the 2018 novel "The Cabin at the End of the World" by Paul G. Tremblay and stars Dave Bautista, Jonathan Groff, Ben Aldridge, Nikki Amuka-Bird, Kristen Cui, and Abby Quinn.

# Plot

The film follows a same-sex couple, Eric and Andrew, who embark on a vacation to a remote cabin in the woods with their adopted daughter, Wen. Their peaceful getaway is disrupted by the arrival of four armed strangers, led by Leonard, who claim that the family must make a horrific choice to prevent the apocalypse. As the situation escalates, Eric and Andrew are forced to confront their own relationship and the true nature of their reality.

As the story unfolds, the family is subjected to a series of physical and emotional challenges, pushing them to their limits. The strangers, who are driven by a mysterious and unsettling conviction, will stop at nothing to achieve their goal. The family must navigate the treacherous terrain of their own fears and doubts in order to survive and uncover the truth behind the apocalyptic threat.

# Cast

* Dave Bautista as Leonard
* Jonathan Groff as Eric
* Ben Aldridge as Andrew
* Nikki Amuka-Bird as Sabrina
* Kristen Cui as Wen
* Abby Quinn as Adriane

# Production

## Development

Knock at the Cabin was first announced in October 2021, with M. Night Shyamalan set to write and direct the film. The project was based on the novel "The Cabin at the End of the World" by Paul G. Tremblay, which was published in 2018. Shyamalan was drawn to the novel's unique blend of psychological horror and apocalyptic themes, and saw an opportunity to create a film that would explore the complexities of human relationships in the face of catastrophic danger.

## Casting

The cast was announced in December 2021, with Dave Bautista, Jonathan Groff, Ben Aldridge, Nikki Amuka-Bird, Kristen Cui, and Abby Quinn all set to star in the film. Bautista, who had previously appeared in films such as Guardians of the Galaxy and Blade Runner 2049, was cast in the lead role of Leonard, the enigmatic leader of the group of strangers. Groff and Aldridge were cast as Eric and Andrew, the same-sex couple at the center of the story, while Amuka-Bird and Cui were cast as Sabrina and Wen, two of the strangers who arrive at the cabin.

## Filming

Principal photography on Knock at the Cabin took place in April and May 2022, with filming locations in Pennsylvania and New Jersey. The film was shot on a relatively modest budget, with a focus on creating a tense and claustrophobic atmosphere. Shyamalan worked closely with his cast and crew to achieve a sense of realism and immediacy, using a combination of handheld camera work and long takes to create a sense of unease and discomfort.

# Release

Knock at the Cabin was released in the United States on February 3, 2023, by Universal Pictures. The film received a wide release, with screenings in over 3,000 theaters across the country. The film was also released in several international markets, including the United Kingdom, Canada, and Australia.

## Home media

Knock at the Cabin was released on digital platforms on March 24, 2023, with a Blu-ray and DVD release following on May 9, 2023. The home media release included several bonus features, including a behind-the-scenes documentary and a commentary track with M. Night Shyamalan.

# Reception

## Box office

Knock at the Cabin was a commercial success, grossing over $150 million worldwide on a budget of $40 million. The film performed well in the United States, where it grossed over $70 million, and also performed strongly in several international markets, including the United Kingdom and Canada.

## Critical response

Knock at the Cabin received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's tense and suspenseful atmosphere. The film holds a 68% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on over 200 reviews, with an average rating of 6.2/10. The critical consensus on the site reads: "Knock at the Cabin is a tense and unsettling thriller, with a strong cast and a sense of real unease." On Metacritic, the film has a score of 58 out of 100, based on over 40 reviews, indicating "mixed or average" reviews.

## Accolades

Knock at the Cabin was nominated for several awards, including the Saturn Award for Best Horror Film and the Fangoria Chainsaw Award for Best Wide Release. The film also received a nomination for the GLAAD Media Award for Outstanding Film, in recognition of its portrayal of a same-sex couple.

article:
Georgia Guidestones

The Georgia Guidestones are a granite monument located in Elbert County, Georgia, United States. The monument is inscribed with a set of ten guidelines or principles, written in eight different languages, intended to provide guidance for humanity in the event of a catastrophic event or global upheaval. The Guidestones have been the subject of much speculation, debate, and conspiracy theories since their construction in 1980.

# History

## Construction

The Georgia Guidestones were constructed in 1980 by a group of individuals who referred to themselves as the "New World Order." The group, led by a man who went by the pseudonym R.C. Christian, approached the Elberton Granite Finishing Company with a proposal to build a monument that would serve as a guide for humanity in the event of a catastrophic event. The company agreed to build the monument, and construction began in 1979. The Guidestones were completed in 1980 and were unveiled on March 22, 1980.

## Reaction

The reaction to the Georgia Guidestones was mixed. Some people saw the monument as a positive and uplifting message, while others were more skeptical. Many were concerned about the origins of the monument and the identity of the individuals who built it. Some conspiracy theories emerged, suggesting that the Guidestones were part of a larger plot to control the world or impose a new world order.

## Destruction

On July 6, 2022, the Georgia Guidestones were severely damaged in a bombing attack. The explosion destroyed a significant portion of the monument, and the remaining sections were later demolished due to safety concerns. The bombing was widely condemned, and an investigation was launched to identify the perpetrators.

### Aftermath

The destruction of the Georgia Guidestones sparked a range of reactions. Some people expressed sadness and loss, while others saw the event as a victory for those who opposed the monument and its perceived message. The destruction of the Guidestones also raised questions about the future of the site and the potential for rebuilding or replacement.

# Description

## Inscriptions

The Georgia Guidestones are inscribed with a set of ten guidelines or principles, written in eight different languages. The inscriptions are as follows:

1. Maintain humanity under 500,000,000 in perpetual balance with nature.
2. Guide reproduction wisely – improving fitness and diversity.
3. Unite humanity with a living new language.
4. Rule passion – faith – tradition – and all things with tempered reason.
5. Protect people and nations with fair laws and just courts.
6. Let all nations rule internally resolving external disputes in a world court.
7. Avoid petty laws and useless officials.
8. Balance personal rights with social duties.
9. Prize truth – beauty – love – seeking harmony with the infinite.
10. Be not a cancer on the earth – Leave room for nature.

## Explanatory tablet

An explanatory tablet, situated near the Guidestones, provides additional context and information about the monument. The tablet explains the origins of the Guidestones and the intentions of the individuals who built them.

## Physical data

The Georgia Guidestones are made of granite and consist of four main stones, each weighing around 20 tons. The stones are arranged in a square formation, with each stone aligned with the four cardinal directions (north, south, east, and west). The stones are also aligned with the celestial bodies, including the sun, moon, and stars.

## Guidestone languages

The inscriptions on the Georgia Guidestones are written in eight different languages: English, Spanish, Swahili, Hindi, Hebrew, Arabic, Chinese, and Russian.

## Astronomical features

The Georgia Guidestones are designed to align with various celestial bodies and astronomical events. The stones are aligned with the rising and setting of the sun and moon, and the position of the stars in the night sky.

# Interpretations

## Conspiracy theories

The Georgia Guidestones have been the subject of numerous conspiracy theories over the years. Some of these theories suggest that the Guidestones are part of a larger plot to control the world or impose a new world order. Others believe that the Guidestones are a message from a secret society or a group of powerful individuals.

article:
Anantarika-karma

Anantarika-karma is a term in Buddhist ethics that refers to a set of actions that are considered to be so severe and reprehensible that they lead to immediate and irreversible spiritual harm. These actions are seen as obstacles to spiritual growth and are considered to be a hindrance to the attainment of enlightenment. In this article, we will explore the concept of Anantarika-karma in detail, including its definition, types, and implications.

# Definition and Meaning

Anantarika-karma is a Sanskrit term that is composed of two words: "anantarika" and "karma". "Anantarika" means "immediately" or "without interval", while "karma" means "action" or "deed". Together, the term Anantarika-karma refers to actions that have immediate and irreparable consequences. In the context of Buddhist ethics, Anantarika-karma refers to actions that are so severe that they lead to immediate spiritual harm and create an insurmountable obstacle to spiritual growth.

## Classification of Anantarika-karma

In Buddhist tradition, Anantarika-karma is classified into five categories:

1. Matricide (killing one's mother)
2. Patricide (killing one's father)
3. Arhat-ocide (killing an Arhat, or a being who has attained enlightenment)
4. Creating a schism in the Sangha (Buddhist community)
5. Shedding the blood of a Buddha

These actions are considered to be so severe that they lead to immediate and irreversible spiritual harm. They are seen as obstacles to spiritual growth and are considered to be a hindrance to the attainment of enlightenment.

## Implications of Anantarika-karma

The implications of Anantarika-karma are far-reaching and severe. According to Buddhist tradition, an individual who commits one of these actions will experience immediate and irreparable spiritual harm. This harm is seen as a hindrance to spiritual growth and is considered to be an obstacle to the attainment of enlightenment.

In addition, Anantarika-karma is seen as a cause of great suffering and negative consequences. An individual who commits one of these actions is said to experience great suffering and hardship in this life and in future lives. This suffering is seen as a direct result of the negative karma created by the action.

# Causes and Conditions

The causes and conditions that lead to Anantarika-karma are complex and multifaceted. According to Buddhist tradition, Anantarika-karma is the result of a combination of factors, including:

## Ignorance

Ignorance is seen as a primary cause of Anantarika-karma. An individual who is ignorant of the true nature of reality and the consequences of their actions is more likely to commit an action that leads to Anantarika-karma.

## Craving and Aversion

Craving and aversion are also seen as causes of Anantarika-karma. An individual who is driven by strong craving or aversion is more likely to commit an action that leads to Anantarika-karma.

## Negative Emotions

Negative emotions such as anger, hatred, and jealousy are also seen as causes of Anantarika-karma. An individual who is consumed by negative emotions is more likely to commit an action that leads to Anantarika-karma.

## Lack of Wisdom

A lack of wisdom is also seen as a cause of Anantarika-karma. An individual who lacks wisdom and does not understand the true nature of reality is more likely to commit an action that leads to Anantarika-karma.

# Consequences

The consequences of Anantarika-karma are severe and far-reaching. According to Buddhist tradition, an individual who commits one of these actions will experience:

## Immediate Spiritual Harm

An individual who commits Anantarika-karma will experience immediate spiritual harm. This harm is seen as a hindrance to spiritual growth and is considered to be an obstacle to the attainment of enlightenment.

## Negative Karma

An individual who commits Anantarika-karma will also create negative karma. This negative karma will lead to suffering and hardship in this life and in future lives.

## Suffering and Hardship

An individual who commits Anantarika-karma will experience great suffering and hardship. This suffering is seen as a direct result of the negative karma created by the action.

## Obstacle to Enlightenment

Anantarika-karma is also seen as an obstacle to enlightenment. An individual who commits one of these actions will create a hindrance to spiritual growth and will be unable to attain enlightenment.

* Keown, D. (2005). Buddhist Ethics: A Very Short Introduction. Oxford University Press.

article:
Land
=====

Land is the solid surface of the Earth that is not covered by water. It is the foundation of human civilization, providing resources, habitat, and a platform for various human activities. Land is a complex and dynamic entity, shaped by geological processes, climate, and human interventions. This article provides a comprehensive overview of land, covering its definition, etymology, physical science, features, layers, life science, human interactions, and environmental issues.

# Definition
Land is generally defined as the solid part of the Earth's surface, excluding oceans, seas, and other bodies of water. It is the terrestrial portion of the planet, encompassing continents, islands, and other landmasses. The concept of land is often contrasted with water, which covers approximately 71% of the Earth's surface.

# Etymology
The word "land" has its roots in ancient languages, including Old English and Germanic. The term "land" is derived from the Proto-Germanic word "*landiz," which is also the source of the Modern English word "land." The word has evolved over time, with various meanings and connotations, including country, territory, and soil.

# Physical Science
Land is shaped by various physical processes that have been occurring over millions of years. These processes include geological formation, weathering, erosion, and deposition.

## Formation
The formation of land is a complex process that involves the movement of tectonic plates, volcanic activity, and the creation of mountains. The Earth's crust is composed of several large plates that move relative to each other, resulting in the creation of mountains, volcanoes, and earthquakes. The process of plate tectonics has shaped the Earth's surface over millions of years, resulting in the formation of continents, oceans, and other landmasses.

## Landmasses
A landmass is a large area of land that is not covered by water. The Earth's surface is composed of seven continents, which are: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America, and South America. Each continent is unique, with its own geography, climate, and features.

## Terrain
Terrain refers to the physical features of the land, including mountains, hills, valleys, and plains. Terrain is shaped by geological processes, such as weathering, erosion, and deposition. Terrain can vary greatly, from the highest mountains to the deepest oceans.

## Geomorphology
Geomorphology is the study of the Earth's surface features and the processes that shape them. Geomorphologists examine the relationship between the Earth's surface and the underlying geological structures, as well as the impact of human activities on the environment.

## Climate
Climate is a critical factor that shapes the Earth's surface and affects the distribution of land features. Climate influences the formation of mountains, the creation of rivers, and the development of soil. Climate also affects the distribution of plants and animals, which in turn shape the landscape.

# Features
Land features refer to the various natural and human-made characteristics of the Earth's surface. These features include coasts, islands, mountains, plateaus, plains, valleys, caves, and craters.

## Coasts and Islands
Coasts are the land areas that border the ocean, sea, or lake. Coasts can be rocky, sandy, or muddy, and are shaped by the interaction between the land and water. Islands are landmasses that are surrounded by water on all sides.

## Mountains and Plateaus
Mountains are natural elevations of the Earth's surface, often formed by tectonic activity or volcanic eruptions. Plateaus are elevated areas of land that are relatively flat and are often formed by erosion or volcanic activity.

## Plains and Valleys
Plains are flat areas of land that are often formed by erosion or deposition. Valleys are low areas of land that are often formed by rivers or glaciers.

## Caves and Craters
Caves are natural openings in the Earth's surface, often formed by erosion or volcanic activity. Craters are depressions in the Earth's surface, often formed by volcanic eruptions or meteorite impacts.

# Layers
Land is composed of several layers, including land cover, soil, and continental crust.

## Land Cover
Land cover refers to the natural or human-made features that cover the Earth's surface. Land cover can include vegetation, water, urban areas, and other features.

## Soil
Soil is the upper layer of the Earth's surface, composed of mineral and organic matter. Soil is formed through the weathering of rocks and the addition of organic matter.

## Continental Crust
The continental crust is the outer layer of the Earth's crust, composed of rocks and minerals. The continental crust is thicker and less dense than the oceanic crust.

# Life Science
Land is home to a diverse range of plants and animals, which are adapted to the various environments and ecosystems.

## Land Biomes
A biome is a large area of land that is characterized by a specific type of vegetation and animal life. There are several land biomes, including forests, grasslands, deserts, and tundras.

## Fauna and Flora
Fauna refers to the animals that live on land, while flora refers to the plants. Land is home to a vast array of fauna and flora, including mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians, and insects.

# Humans and Land
Humans have a complex and multifaceted relationship with land, which is shaped by culture, history, and economics.

## Culture
Land is often imbued with cultural significance, reflecting the values and traditions of a particular society. Land can be a source of identity, community, and spirituality.

## Travel
Humans have traveled across land for thousands of years, driven by exploration, trade, and migration. Travel has shaped the course of human history, facilitating the exchange of ideas, cultures, and technologies.

## Trade
Land is a critical factor in trade, providing resources, infrastructure, and markets. Trade has shaped the global economy, influencing the distribution of wealth and power.

## Land Use
Land use refers to the way in which humans utilize the land, including agriculture, urbanization, and conservation. Land use is a critical factor in shaping the environment and affecting the distribution of resources.

## Law
Land is governed by laws and regulations, which vary across different countries and jurisdictions. Land law is a complex and evolving field, reflecting the changing relationships between humans and the environment.

## Geopolitics
Geopolitics refers to the study of the relationship between geography, politics, and international relations. Geopolitics is shaped by the distribution of land, resources, and power, influencing the course of global events.

# Environmental Issues
Land is facing numerous environmental challenges, including soil degradation, pollution, biodiversity loss, and resource depletion.

## Soil Degradation
Soil degradation refers to the decline in soil quality, often caused by erosion, salinization, or nutrient depletion. Soil degradation can have significant impacts on agriculture, ecosystems, and human health.

## Pollution
Pollution refers to the contamination of the environment, often caused by human activities such as industrialization, transportation, and agriculture. Pollution can have significant impacts on ecosystems, human health, and the economy.

## Biodiversity Loss
Biodiversity loss refers to the decline in the variety of plants and animals, often caused by habitat destruction, climate change, and human activities. Biodiversity loss can have significant impacts on ecosystems, human health, and the economy.

## Resource Depletion
Resource depletion refers to the decline in the availability of natural resources, often caused by overexploitation, climate change, and human activities. Resource depletion can have significant impacts on human well-being, economic development, and environmental sustainability.

# Gallery

# See Also

* Earth
* Geography
* Geology
* Ecosystem
* Environment
* Conservation

article:
Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan

Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan is a 2023 Indian action comedy film directed by Farhad Samji and produced by Salman Khan Films and Zee Studios. The film stars Salman Khan, Venkatesh, Pooja Hegde, Jagapathi Babu, and Bhumika Chawla in key roles.

#Plot

The film's plot revolves around a young man, Bhaijaan (Salman Khan), who is a kind-hearted and humble person, but also a fierce protector of his loved ones. He lives in a small town with his family and friends and is known for his unwavering dedication to those he cares about. However, his life takes a dramatic turn when he meets a beautiful woman, Bhagyalakshmi (Pooja Hegde), who is being threatened by a powerful and corrupt businessman. Bhaijaan decides to help Bhagyalakshmi and in the process, he must confront the businessman and his henchmen.

As the story unfolds, Bhaijaan's past is revealed, and his connection to a notorious gangster, Ramesh (Venkatesh), is exposed. Ramesh is a ruthless and cunning individual who will stop at nothing to achieve his goals. Bhaijaan must use his wits and strength to outsmart Ramesh and his men and protect his loved ones.

Throughout the film, Bhaijaan's relationships with his family and friends are explored, and his character is developed further. The film features a blend of action, comedy, and drama, making it an entertaining and engaging watch.

#Cast

* Salman Khan as Bhaijaan
* Venkatesh as Ramesh
* Pooja Hegde as Bhagyalakshmi
* Jagapathi Babu as Rajesh
* Bhumika Chawla as Nandini
* Raghav Juyal as Jaga
* Siddharth Nigam as Guru
* Jass Manak as Rocky
* Shehnaaz Gill as Sobia
* Palak Tiwari as Sanjana

#Production

##Development

The film was first announced in 2020, with Salman Khan and Farhad Samji attached to the project. The film's script was written by Sajid and Farhad Samji, and it was produced by Salman Khan Films and Zee Studios.

##Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in 2020, with the cast and crew undergoing extensive preparations. Salman Khan underwent a significant physical transformation for the film, losing weight and building muscle. The film's sets were designed by action director, Anbariv, who also choreographed the film's action sequences.

##Casting

The film's cast was finalized in 2020, with Pooja Hegde and Venkatesh joining the project. Jagapathi Babu, Bhumika Chawla, and Raghav Juyal were also cast in key roles. The film features a diverse cast, with actors from different regions and languages.

##Filming

Filming on the film began in 2020 and took place in various locations, including Mumbai, Hyderabad, and Dubai. The film's action sequences were shot in Dubai, and the film's climax was shot in a single take. Salman Khan performed many of his own stunts in the film.

##Post-production

Post-production on the film began in 2022, with the film's editing and visual effects being completed. The film's music was composed by Himesh Reshammiya, and the film's background score was composed by Sajid-Wajid.

#Music

The film's music was composed by Himesh Reshammiya, and the film's background score was composed by Sajid-Wajid. The film features six songs, including the hit single, "Jee Rahe The Hum". The film's music was well-received by critics and audiences alike.

#Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in 2022, with the film's trailer being released in March 2022. The film's posters and teasers were released in the months leading up to the film's release. The film's cast and crew promoted the film extensively on social media.

#Release

##Theatrical

The film was released theatrically on April 21, 2023. The film was released in over 5000 screens worldwide, making it one of the widest releases of the year.

##Home media

The film was released on home media platforms in June 2023. The film was released on DVD, Blu-ray, and digital platforms.

#Reception

##Critical reception

The film received mixed reviews from critics. Critics praised the film's action sequences and Salman Khan's performance, but criticized the film's script and direction. The film holds a 50% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes.

##Box office

The film performed well at the box office, grossing over 200 crore worldwide. The film was a commercial success, and it helped to establish Salman Khan as one of the biggest stars in India.

article:
History of the Telephone in the United States

The history of the telephone in the United States is a long and complex one, spanning over a century. From its invention in 1876 by Alexander Graham Bell to the widespread use of cellphones and smartphones today, the telephone has revolutionized the way people communicate. This article will explore the major developments in the history of the telephone in the United States, including the rise of AT&T and the Bell System, the impact of cellphones and smartphones, and the social and cultural effects of telephone use.

# AT&T and the Bell System

AT&T, also known as the Bell System, played a dominant role in the development and expansion of the telephone industry in the United States. The company's history can be divided into several key periods, including the formation of the American Bell Telephone Company, the creation of AT&T, and the breakup of the company in 1982.

## American Bell Telephone Company (1881–1899)

The American Bell Telephone Company was formed in 1881 by Alexander Graham Bell and his investors. The company's primary goal was to commercialize the telephone, which had been invented by Bell just a few years earlier. American Bell quickly expanded its operations, establishing telephone exchanges in cities across the United States. The company also developed a number of key technologies, including the switchboard, which allowed multiple telephones to be connected to a single exchange.

## AT&T (1899–1982)

In 1899, American Bell was reorganized as AT&T, with Theodore Vail as its first president. Vail played a key role in shaping the company's strategy, focusing on expanding its operations and improving the quality of its service. During the early 20th century, AT&T continued to grow, acquiring a number of smaller telephone companies and expanding its operations into new areas.

## Research priority

AT&T placed a strong emphasis on research and development, establishing a number of research laboratories, including Bell Labs. These labs were responsible for developing many of the key technologies that drove the growth of the telephone industry, including the transistor, the laser, and the Unix operating system.

## Targeting an audience

AT&T also placed a strong emphasis on marketing and customer service, targeting specific audiences with tailored advertising and promotional campaigns.

### Urban public telephones

In the early 20th century, AT&T began installing public telephones in urban areas, providing access to telephone service for people who did not have a phone at home. These public telephones quickly became a common sight in cities across the United States.

### Rural telephone service

AT&T also worked to expand telephone service to rural areas, where it was often difficult to install and maintain telephone lines. The company developed a number of innovative solutions, including the use of radio telephones and microwave transmission systems.

## Breakup of AT&T in 1982

In 1982, AT&T was broken up into a number of smaller companies, including the Regional Bell Operating Companies (RBOCs). This breakup was the result of a long-running antitrust lawsuit, which had been filed against AT&T in the 1970s. The breakup of AT&T marked a significant turning point in the history of the telephone industry in the United States, leading to increased competition and innovation in the years that followed.

# Cellphones and smartphones

The development of cellphones and smartphones has had a profound impact on the telephone industry in the United States. The first cellphones were introduced in the 1980s, but it wasn't until the 1990s that they became widely popular. The introduction of smartphones, which combine the functionality of a phone with the features of a computer, has further transformed the industry.

# Personnel

The telephone industry has a long history of employing a diverse range of personnel, from switchboard operators to engineers and technicians.

## Switchboard and operators

In the early days of the telephone industry, switchboard operators played a crucial role in connecting calls. These operators were responsible for answering calls, directing them to the correct destination, and handling a wide range of customer inquiries.

## Labor force: bias for and against women

The telephone industry has a complex history when it comes to the employment of women. On the one hand, the industry provided many women with their first opportunities for paid employment outside the home. On the other hand, women were often relegated to lower-paying jobs and faced significant barriers to advancement.

### Strikes

In the early 20th century, telephone operators went on strike in a number of cities, demanding better pay and working conditions. These strikes were often marked by violent clashes between strikers and management.

## Hawthorne studies

In the 1920s and 1930s, a series of studies were conducted at the Hawthorne Works, a Western Electric factory in Chicago. These studies, which were designed to investigate the impact of working conditions on productivity, had a profound impact on the development of modern management theory.

## Employee benefits

The telephone industry has a long history of providing its employees with a range of benefits, including health insurance, pensions, and paid vacation time.

# Users

The telephone has had a profound impact on the way people live and work in the United States. From businesses to households, the telephone has become an essential tool for communication and connection.

## Business

The telephone has played a crucial role in the development of modern business, enabling companies to communicate with customers, suppliers, and partners across the country and around the world.

## Housewives

The telephone has also had a significant impact on the lives of housewives, providing them with a means of connecting with friends and family, as well as accessing a range of services and information.

## Gender and culture roles

The telephone has played a complex role in shaping gender and cultural roles in the United States. On the one hand, the telephone has provided women with greater independence and autonomy. On the other hand, it has also reinforced traditional gender roles and stereotypes.

## Telemarketing

The telephone has also been used for telemarketing, which involves contacting potential customers by phone to sell them products or services.

## 9-1-1

The telephone has played a crucial role in the development of emergency services, including the 9-1-1 system, which was introduced in the 1960s.

## Harassing calls

The telephone has also been used for harassing calls, which can be a significant problem for individuals and households.

## Literary fears

The telephone has also been the subject of a range of literary fears and anxieties, including the fear of being disconnected or unreachable.

* Cellphone
* Smartphone

* Marvin, Carolyn. When Old Technologies Were New: Thinking About Electric Communication in the Late Nineteenth Century. New York: Oxford University Press, 1988.
* Fischer, Claude S. America Calling: A Social History of the Telephone to 1940. Berkeley: University of California Press, 1992.

article:
Eknath Shinde

Eknath Shinde is an Indian politician serving as the 20th Chief Minister of Maharashtra since June 2022. He is a member of the Shiv Sena party and represents the Kopri-Pachpakhadi constituency in the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly.

#Early life

Eknath Shinde was born on 9 February 1964 in the Satara district of Maharashtra. His family later moved to Thane, where he spent most of his childhood. Shinde's father, Sambhaji Shinde, was a laborer, and his mother, Yashoda Shinde, was a homemaker. He has two siblings, a brother named Nitin Shinde and a sister named Kavita Shinde.

Shinde completed his early education at the Tilak Nagar Municipal High School in Thane. He later attended the Terna College in Nerul, Navi Mumbai, where he earned a Bachelor of Arts degree. After completing his education, Shinde worked as a laborer and later as a shop owner before entering politics.

#Early political career

##Entry into politics

Eknath Shinde's entry into politics was influenced by his family's association with the Shiv Sena party. His father, Sambhaji Shinde, was a member of the party, and Shinde would often accompany him to party meetings and events. In the 1980s, Shinde joined the party's youth wing, the Yuva Sena, and quickly rose through the ranks.

Shinde's early involvement in politics was focused on local issues in Thane, where he worked to resolve civic problems and provide assistance to residents. He gained recognition within the party for his organizational skills and his ability to connect with people at the grassroots level.

##Maharashtra Legislative Assembly & ministries

In 2004, Shinde was elected to the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly from the Thane constituency. He was re-elected in 2009 and 2014, representing the Kopri-Pachpakhadi constituency. During his tenure as an MLA, Shinde held various portfolios, including Public Works, Urban Development, and Transport.

As a minister, Shinde was known for his work in improving the infrastructure of Thane and surrounding areas. He played a key role in the development of the Eastern Express Highway and the construction of several flyovers and bridges in the region.

#Role in 2022 Maharashtra political crisis

In June 2022, Eknath Shinde played a crucial role in the Maharashtra political crisis that led to the downfall of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government. Shinde, who was then the Urban Development Minister, rebelled against the Shiv Sena leadership, citing dissatisfaction with the party's alliance with the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and the Indian National Congress (INC).

Shinde's rebellion was backed by a group of MLAs from the Shiv Sena, who were dissatisfied with the party's leadership and the MVA government's policies. The group of rebels, led by Shinde, demanded that the Shiv Sena withdraw from the MVA alliance and form a government with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).

The crisis led to a split in the Shiv Sena, with Shinde's faction forming a new alliance with the BJP. The MVA government, led by Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray, was eventually toppled, and Shinde was sworn in as the new Chief Minister of Maharashtra.

#Chief Minister

Eknath Shinde was sworn in as the 20th Chief Minister of Maharashtra on 30 June 2022. His appointment was backed by the BJP, which had been a key player in the Maharashtra political crisis.

As Chief Minister, Shinde has focused on several key areas, including infrastructure development, economic growth, and social welfare. He has announced several initiatives aimed at improving the state's infrastructure, including the construction of new roads, bridges, and flyovers.

Shinde has also emphasized the need for greater transparency and accountability in governance. He has announced plans to implement a new system of governance that will allow citizens to track the progress of government projects and schemes.

##Electoral performance

Eknath Shinde has contested several elections, including the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly elections and the Thane Municipal Corporation elections. His electoral performance has been impressive, with him winning several elections with a significant margin.

| Election | Constituency | Party | Result |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 2004 Maharashtra Legislative Assembly election | Thane | Shiv Sena | Won |
| 2009 Maharashtra Legislative Assembly election | Kopri-Pachpakhadi | Shiv Sena | Won |
| 2014 Maharashtra Legislative Assembly election | Kopri-Pachpakhadi | Shiv Sena | Won |
| 2019 Maharashtra Legislative Assembly election | Kopri-Pachpakhadi | Shiv Sena | Won |

#Leader of Shiv Sena

Eknath Shinde is currently the leader of the Shiv Sena party, although his leadership is disputed by the party's Uddhav Thackeray faction.

##Shiv Sena leadership dispute

The Shiv Sena leadership dispute began in June 2022, when Shinde rebelled against the party's leadership. The dispute has led to a split in the party, with Shinde's faction forming a new alliance with the BJP.

The Uddhav Thackeray faction has challenged Shinde's leadership, claiming that he has no authority to lead the party. The faction has filed a petition in the Bombay High Court, seeking a stay on Shinde's leadership.

##Political legitimacy

Shinde's political legitimacy has been questioned by several opposition parties, including the NCP and the INC. The parties have claimed that Shinde's appointment as Chief Minister is unconstitutional and that he has no mandate to lead the state.

The BJP has backed Shinde's leadership, claiming that he has the support of a majority of MLAs in the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly.

#Personal life

Eknath Shinde is married to Latabai Shinde, and the couple has three children: two sons, Shrikant Shinde and Purvesh Shinde, and a daughter, Hemali Shinde.

Shinde is a Hindu and follows the traditional customs and practices of his community. He is known to be a devout follower of Lord Ganesha and often visits temples and shrines during his spare time.

#Popular culture

Eknath Shinde has been featured in several news articles and television programs, including a documentary series on the Maharashtra political crisis.

Shinde has also been the subject of several memes and jokes on social media, with many users poking fun at his role in the Maharashtra political crisis.

2022 NCAA Division I FBS football season

The 2022 NCAA Division I FBS football season was the 153rd season of college football in the United States, and the 11th season in the College Football Playoff (CFP) era. The season began on August 27, 2022, and ended on January 9, 2023.

# Rule changes

The NCAA introduced several rule changes for the 2022 season, including the expansion of the instant replay review system to include all games, not just those involving teams ranked in the top 25. Additionally, the NCAA introduced a new rule requiring players to wear a certain type of helmet, which is designed to reduce the risk of concussion.

# Conference realignment

2022 Kwibuka Women's T20 Tournament

The 2022 Kwibuka Women's T20 Tournament was a women's Twenty20 International (T20I) cricket tournament that took place in Rwanda from June 9 to June 18, 2022. The tournament was the ninth edition of the Kwibuka Women's T20 Tournament and featured eight teams from Africa. The tournament was played in a round-robin format, followed by play-offs to determine the winner.

article:
Darjeeling

Darjeeling is a city and a municipality in the Indian state of West Bengal. It is located in the Lesser Himalayas at an elevation of 2,042 meters (6,700 feet) above sea level. The city is situated in the Darjeeling district, which is a part of the Jalpaiguri division. Darjeeling is known for its tea plantations, scenic beauty, and toy train.

# Toponymy

The name "Darjeeling" is derived from the Tibetan word "dorje," which means "thunderbolt," and the Nepali word "ling," which means "place" or "land." The name refers to the Dorje Ling monastery, which was located in the area.

# History

## 1780 to 1835

The area that is now Darjeeling was originally inhabited by the Lepcha people, who were later joined by the Bhutia people. In 1780, the area was annexed by the Kingdom of Sikkim. The British East India Company became interested in the area due to its strategic location and climate, which made it suitable for tea plantations.

## 1835–1857: East India Company rule

In 1835, the British East India Company annexed the area from the Kingdom of Sikkim and established the Darjeeling district. The company brought in tea planters from other parts of India and began to develop the area's tea industry. During this period, the town of Darjeeling began to grow, and the first roads, schools, and hospitals were built.

## 1858–1947: British Raj

After the Indian Rebellion of 1857, the British Crown took over the administration of India from the East India Company. Darjeeling became a hill station and a popular resort for the British, who were attracted by its cool climate and scenic beauty. The town continued to grow, and new infrastructure, including roads, railways, and buildings, was developed.

## 1947 onwards: independent India

After India gained independence in 1947, Darjeeling became a part of the state of West Bengal. The town continued to grow, and the tea industry remained a major contributor to the local economy. In recent years, tourism has become an increasingly important sector, with visitors attracted by the town's scenic beauty, tea plantations, and cultural heritage.

# Geography and geology

Darjeeling is located in the Lesser Himalayas at an elevation of 2,042 meters (6,700 feet) above sea level. The town is situated in the Darjeeling district, which covers an area of approximately 3,149 square kilometers (1,216 square miles). The district is bounded by the state of Sikkim to the north, the country of Bhutan to the east, and the districts of Jalpaiguri and Uttar Dinajpur to the south and west, respectively.

The geology of Darjeeling is characterized by the presence of rocks from the Proterozoic to the Quaternary periods. The rocks are mainly composed of gneiss, schist, and granite. The terrain is hilly and mountainous, with steep slopes and deep valleys.

# Climate and environment

## Climate

Darjeeling has a subtropical highland climate, with cool summers and cold winters. The average temperature ranges from 11.2°C (52.2°F) in January, the coldest month, to 19.1°C (66.4°F) in July, the warmest month. The town receives moderate rainfall, with an average annual rainfall of 3,102 millimeters (122 inches).

## Environment

The environment in Darjeeling is characterized by the presence of temperate forests, grasslands, and wetlands. The forests are dominated by species such as rhododendron, oak, and pine. The town is home to a variety of wildlife, including the red panda, the Himalayan black bear, and the clouded leopard.

# Flora and fauna

Darjeeling is home to a diverse range of flora and fauna. The town's temperate forests are dominated by species such as rhododendron, oak, and pine. The forests are also home to a variety of wildlife, including the red panda, the Himalayan black bear, and the clouded leopard.

# Demographics

As of the 2011 census, the population of Darjeeling was 132,016. The population density was approximately 4,200 people per square kilometer (11,000 people per square mile). The sex ratio was approximately 971 females per 1,000 males. The literacy rate was approximately 93%.

# Governance

Darjeeling is governed by the Darjeeling Municipality, which is responsible for providing basic civic amenities such as water supply, sanitation, and waste management. The municipality is headed by a chairman, who is elected by the members of the municipality.

# Economy

## Tea

The tea industry is a major contributor to the economy of Darjeeling. The town is famous for its Darjeeling tea, which is grown in the surrounding tea gardens. The tea industry provides employment to thousands of people in the town and contributes significantly to the local economy.

## Tourism

Tourism is an increasingly important sector in Darjeeling. The town attracts visitors from all over the world, who are drawn by its scenic beauty, tea plantations, and cultural heritage. The town has a range of hotels, restaurants, and other tourist infrastructure.

# Utilities

Darjeeling has a range of utilities, including water supply, sanitation, and waste management. The town is also connected to the national grid and has a reliable supply of electricity.

# Transport

Darjeeling is connected to the rest of India by road and rail. The town has a railway station, which is connected to the major cities of India. The town is also connected to the nearby cities of Siliguri and Kolkata by road.

# Culture

Darjeeling has a unique cultural heritage, which is influenced by its location in the Himalayas. The town is home to a variety of festivals and cultural events, including the Darjeeling Carnival and the Darjeeling Tea Festival.

## Food

The cuisine in Darjeeling is a blend of Indian, Chinese, and Tibetan influences. The town is famous for its momos, which are Tibetan-style dumplings. The town is also known for its tea, which is grown in the surrounding tea gardens.

# Education

Darjeeling has a range of educational institutions, including schools, colleges, and universities. The town is home to the Darjeeling Government College, which is one of the oldest colleges in the state of West Bengal.

# Explanatory notes

This article uses the term "Darjeeling" to refer to the city and municipality, as well as the surrounding district.

# References

article:
KGF: Chapter 2

KGF: Chapter 2 is a 2022 Indian Kannada-language period action film written and directed by Prashanth Neel. The film is the sequel to the 2018 film KGF: Chapter 1 and the second installment in the KGF film series. The film stars Yash, Sanjay Dutt, Srinidhi Shetty, Raveena Tandon, and Archana Jois.

# Plot

The film picks up where the first installment left off, with Rocky (Yash) having taken over the Kolar Gold Fields (KGF) and established himself as a powerful force in the region. However, his reign is threatened by the arrival of Adheera (Sanjay Dutt), the brother of Suryavardhan, who was killed by Rocky in the first film. Adheera is determined to take revenge and reclaim the KGF empire.

As tensions rise between Rocky and Adheera, the government intervenes, and a new administrator, Ramika Sen (Raveena Tandon), is appointed to oversee the KGF. Rocky must navigate this new threat while also dealing with the internal power struggles within the KGF.

Meanwhile, Rocky's relationship with Reena (Srinidhi Shetty) deepens, but their love is put to the test by the circumstances surrounding them. The film's climax features an epic battle between Rocky and Adheera, with the fate of the KGF hanging in the balance.

# Cast

* Yash as Rocky
* Sanjay Dutt as Adheera
* Srinidhi Shetty as Reena
* Raveena Tandon as Ramika Sen
* Archana Jois as Shanthamma
* Anant Nag as Anand Ingalagi
* Malavika Avinash as Deepa Hegde
* Eswari Rao as Feroz's mother
* Rao Ramesh as CBI officer
* T. S. Nagabharana as Srinivas
* Vasishta Simha as Kamal
* Harish Rai as Rajendra Desai
* Dinesh Mangalore as Shetty
* Lakki Lakshman as Linga
* Ramachandra Raju as Garuda

# Production

## Development

The development of KGF: Chapter 2 began shortly after the release of the first film. Director Prashanth Neel had always envisioned the story as a two-part series, and he began working on the script for the sequel in 2018. The film's producer, Vijay Kiragandur, was keen to bring the story to a close, and he greenlit the project in early 2019.

## Casting

The casting process for the film began in early 2019, with Yash and Srinidhi Shetty reprising their roles from the first film. Sanjay Dutt was cast as the main antagonist, Adheera, in March 2019. Raveena Tandon was cast as Ramika Sen in June 2019, marking her debut in Kannada cinema.

## Filming

Principal photography for the film began on March 13, 2019, in Bengaluru. The film was shot on a massive scale, with a large portion of the budget allocated to the construction of sets and the hiring of international stunt teams. The film's cinematographer, Bhuvan Gowda, used a combination of traditional and modern techniques to capture the film's epic scope.

The film's shoot was not without its challenges, however. The team faced numerous delays due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and the film's release was pushed back several times. The team also faced opposition from local residents in Bengaluru, who objected to the construction of sets in their neighborhoods.

# Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by Ravi Basrur, who also composed the music for the first film. The soundtrack features five songs, including the hit single "Toofan." The film's score was also composed by Basrur, who used a combination of traditional and modern instruments to create the film's epic soundtrack.

# Marketing

The marketing campaign for KGF: Chapter 2 began in early 2020, with the release of a series of teasers and trailers. The film's trailer was released in January 2020 and quickly went viral, with millions of views on YouTube.

The film's team also launched a series of promotional activities, including a fan meet-and-greet event in Bengaluru. The film's star, Yash, also embarked on a promotional tour of India, visiting several cities to promote the film.

# Release

## Theatrical

KGF: Chapter 2 was released theatrically on April 14, 2022, in India and several other countries. The film was released in multiple languages, including Kannada, Hindi, Telugu, and Tamil.

## Screening

The film received a wide release, with over 10,000 screens allocated worldwide. The film was also screened at several film festivals, including the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne.

## Distribution

The film's distribution rights were acquired by Excel Entertainment and AA Films in India, while the international distribution rights were acquired by Phars Film.

## Home media

The film's digital rights were acquired by Amazon Prime Video, which released the film on its platform in May 2022. The film's satellite rights were acquired by Zee Kannada.

# Critical reception

KGF: Chapter 2 received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. The film's epic scope, stunning action sequences, and strong performances were praised by critics. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 7.5/10.

The Hindu praised the film's "ambitious" scope and "stunning" action sequences, while The Indian Express praised the film's "strong" performances and "epic" soundtrack. The Times of India praised the film's "visually stunning" action sequences and "strong" performances.

# Box office

## India

KGF: Chapter 2 was a major commercial success in India, grossing over ₹1,000 crore (US$140 million) at the domestic box office. The film became the highest-grossing Kannada film of all time, surpassing the record set by KGF: Chapter 1.

## Other territories

The film was also a commercial success in other territories, grossing over ₹500 crore (US$70 million) in the United States, Australia, and the United Arab Emirates.

# Accolades

KGF: Chapter 2 won several awards and nominations, including the Filmfare Award for Best Film – Kannada and the IIFA Utsavam Award for Best Film – Kannada.

# Future

A third installment in the KGF franchise has been announced, with Prashanth Neel set to direct. The film is expected to go into production in 2023.

# Notes

* KGF: Chapter 2 is the first Indian film to be shot using the IMAX camera.
* The film's budget was estimated to be over ₹100 crore (US$14 million), making it one of the most expensive Indian films ever made.
* The film's action sequences were choreographed by international stunt teams, including the renowned stunt team from the John Wick franchise.

# References

*Note: No references are included in this article as per your request.*

# External links

* KGF: Chapter 2 on IMDb
* KGF: Chapter 2 on Rotten Tomatoes

2023 Davis Cup Finals

The 2023 Davis Cup Finals was the 111th edition of the Davis Cup, a men's international team tennis competition run by the International Tennis Federation (ITF). The tournament took place from September 12 to 17, 2023, in various cities around the world.

# Group stage

## Participating teams

Eighteen teams participated in the 2023 Davis Cup Finals. The teams were divided into six groups of three teams each.

## Seeds

The teams were seeded based on their performance in the 2022 Davis Cup. The top six teams were seeded as follows:

1.  Canada
2.  Spain
3.  Australia
4.  Germany
5.  Italy
6.  Great Britain

## Format

Each team played two round-robin matches against the other teams in their group. The top team in each group advanced to the knockout stage.

## Team nominations

Each team nominated a team of four players. The teams were announced on September 5, 2023.

### Group A

*  Canada: Félix Auger-Aliassime, Denis Shapovalov, Vasek Pospisil, and Gabriel Diallo

article:
# Lists of Alfred Hitchcock Presents Episodes

Alfred Hitchcock Presents is a television anthology series that aired from 1955 to 1962, hosted and produced by the renowned film director Alfred Hitchcock. The series featured a diverse range of genres, including horror, suspense, mystery, and drama. Over the course of its seven-season run, the show aired a total of 268 episodes, each with a unique story and cast.

## Season 1 (1955-1956)

The first season of Alfred Hitchcock Presents premiered on October 2, 1955, and consisted of 39 episodes. This season set the tone for the series, introducing audiences to Hitchcock's wit and irreverent sense of humor. Some notable episodes from this season include "Revenge," which tells the story of a couple's tragic fate, and "The Case of Mr. Pelham," a psychological thriller about a man who begins to question his own identity.

## Season 2 (1956-1957)

The second season of Alfred Hitchcock Presents premiered on September 30, 1956, and consisted of 39 episodes. This season saw the introduction of new writers and directors, including Robert Bloch, who would go on to write the novel Psycho. Some notable episodes from this season include "The Glass Eye," a haunting tale of a ventriloquist's dummy come to life, and "One More Mile to Go," a tense thriller about a man who is stalked by a vengeful ex-con.

## Season 3 (1957-1958)

The third season of Alfred Hitchcock Presents premiered on October 6, 1957, and consisted of 39 episodes. This season featured some of the series' most iconic episodes, including "The Perfect Crime," a clever tale of murder and deception, and "Lamb to the Slaughter," a dark comedy about a woman who kills her husband with a frozen leg of lamb.

## Season 4 (1958-1959)

The fourth season of Alfred Hitchcock Presents premiered on October 5, 1958, and consisted of 36 episodes. This season saw the introduction of new themes and styles, including science fiction and fantasy. Some notable episodes from this season include "Poison," a tense thriller about a man who is bitten by a poisonous snake, and "Banquo's Chair," a supernatural tale of a ghostly apparition.

## Season 5 (1959-1960)

The fifth season of Alfred Hitchcock Presents premiered on October 4, 1959, and consisted of 38 episodes. This season featured some of the series' most memorable episodes, including "Arthur," a dark comedy about a man who is haunted by his own conscience, and "The Crystal Trench," a suspenseful tale of a woman who is trapped in a glacier.

## Season 6 (1960-1961)

The sixth season of Alfred Hitchcock Presents premiered on September 27, 1960, and consisted of 38 episodes. This season saw the introduction of new writers and directors, including Robert Bloch, who wrote the episode "The Big Switch." Some notable episodes from this season include "The Horse Player," a tense thriller about a priest who becomes embroiled in a horse racing scam, and "The Changing Heart," a supernatural tale of a woman who is haunted by her own heart.

## Season 7 (1961-1962)

The seventh and final season of Alfred Hitchcock Presents premiered on October 10, 1961, and consisted of 39 episodes. This season featured some of the series' most iconic episodes, including "The Door Without a Key," a suspenseful tale of a woman who is trapped in a room with no exit, and "Kangaroo Court," a dark comedy about a man who is put on trial by a group of kangaroos.

## Episode List

Below is a complete list of all 268 episodes of Alfred Hitchcock Presents, including their original air dates and episode numbers.

* Season 1 (1955-1956): 39 episodes
* Season 2 (1956-1957): 39 episodes
* Season 3 (1957-1958): 39 episodes
* Season 4 (1958-1959): 36 episodes
* Season 5 (1959-1960): 38 episodes
* Season 6 (1960-1961): 38 episodes
* Season 7 (1961-1962): 39 episodes

================

Valimai is a 2022 Indian Tamil-language action thriller film written and directed by H. Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor under the banner of Bayview Projects LLP and Zee Studios. The film stars Ajith Kumar, Huma Qureshi, and Kartikeya Gummakonda in the lead roles. Valimai is a story about a cop who sets out to track down a group of criminals involved in a chain-snatching racket.

Plot
-----

The film follows the story of Arjun (Ajith Kumar), a police officer who is tasked with solving a string of chain-snatching cases in Chennai. As he delves deeper into the case, he discovers that the crimes are not just random acts of theft, but are actually part of a larger, more complex racket. Arjun's investigation leads him to a group of thieves, led by Naren (Kartikeya Gummakonda), who are involved in the chain-snatching racket. Production

### Development

The project was first announced in November 2019, with H. Vinoth directing and Boney Kapoor producing. The film was initially titled "Valimai" and was set to be released in 2020. However, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the film's release was delayed several times.

Ajith Kumar was cast in the lead role of Arjun in November 2019. Huma Qureshi was cast as the female lead in January 2020. Kartikeya Gummakonda was cast as the antagonist in February 2020. The rest of the cast, including Bani J, Sumithra, and Yogi Babu, were cast in the following months.

Marketing

The film's promotional activities included a series of interviews with the cast and crew, as well as the release of several posters and stills.

Release

Rockhampton–Emu Park Road
==========================

The Rockhampton–Emu Park Road is a major road in Central Queensland, Australia, connecting the city of Rockhampton to the coastal town of Emu Park. The road spans approximately 45 kilometers and plays a vital role in the region's transportation network, providing access to various rural communities, tourist attractions, and industrial areas.

Route Description
-----------------

The Rockhampton–Emu Park Road begins at the intersection with the Bruce Highway in Rockhampton, near the city's central business district. From there, it heads eastwards, passing through the suburbs of Nerimbera and Lakes Creek. The road then traverses the rural areas of Cawarral and Coorooman, before entering the coastal town of Emu Park.

The road is generally straight, with some gentle curves and bends, particularly in the rural sections. The terrain is relatively flat, with some slight inclines and declines near the coast. The road passes through a mix of urban, rural, and natural environments, including forests, farmlands, and coastal wetlands.

Road Condition
---------------

The Rockhampton–Emu Park Road is a sealed road, with a bitumen surface throughout its length. The road is generally well-maintained, with regular resurfacing and maintenance works carried out by the Queensland Department of Transport and Main Roads.

### Road Train Access to Rockhampton

The Rockhampton–Emu Park Road is an important route for road trains and heavy vehicles, providing access to the city of Rockhampton and its industrial areas. The road is designated as a Type 2 road train route, allowing for vehicles up to 36.5 meters in length and 4.2 meters in width. However, there are some restrictions and requirements for road trains using this route, including the need for permits and escorts in certain sections.

### Overtaking Lanes and Safety Improvements

The Rockhampton–Emu Park Road has several overtaking lanes and safety improvements, particularly in the rural sections. These include:

* Roadside furniture: The road has roadside furniture such as guardrails, crash barriers, and signage to improve safety.
* Lighting: The road has street lighting installed in urban areas and at major intersections.

History
--------

The Rockhampton–Emu Park Road has a long history, dating back to the late 19th century. The road was originally built as a dirt track, connecting the city of Rockhampton to the coastal town of Emu Park. Over the years, the road has undergone several upgrades and improvements, including the installation of a bitumen surface and the construction of overtaking lanes and safety improvements.

Current Usage
--------------

The Rockhampton–Emu Park Road is a busy road, with a high volume of traffic, particularly during peak hours and holiday periods. The road is used by a mix of local and tourist traffic, including:

* Commuters: The road is used by commuters traveling to and from work in Rockhampton and Emu Park.
* Tourists: The road is used by tourists visiting the coastal town of Emu Park and its surrounding attractions.

# Plot

However, their holiday gathering is disrupted by a group of mercenaries, led by Scrooge, who invade the mansion and take the family hostage. Meanwhile, a rough-around-the-edges Santa Claus, played by David Harbour, finds himself caught in the middle of the chaos.

As the night unfolds, Santa must use his unique set of skills to take down the mercenaries and save the Gerber family. Along the way, he also teaches them the true meaning of Christmas and helps them to reconcile their differences.

The film combines elements of action, comedy, and holiday cheer, making it a unique and entertaining addition to the Christmas movie genre.

=====================

Supertalk Mississippi is a network of radio stations broadcasting in the state of Mississippi, United States. The network is known for its talk radio format, featuring a mix of local and national programming, news, and sports coverage. History
--------

Supertalk Mississippi was founded in the late 1990s by Telesouth Communications, a media company based in Tupelo, Mississippi. Over the years, Supertalk Mississippi has undergone several changes in ownership and programming, but its commitment to providing high-quality content and community engagement has remained constant.

article:
Sinéad O'Connor
================

Sinéad O'Connor is an Irish singer-songwriter known for her powerful, emotive voice and unflinching lyrics that often address social justice and personal struggles. With a career spanning over three decades, O'Connor has released numerous critically acclaimed albums and has been recognized for her innovative and provocative style.

Early Life and Education
------------------------

Sinéad O'Connor was born on December 8, 1970, in Dublin, Ireland, to Sean O'Connor, a structural engineer, and Marie O'Connor, a dressmaker. She was the third of four children, and her parents divorced when she was eight years old. O'Connor's mother, who struggled with addiction and mental health issues, was largely absent from her life, and she was raised by her father and his relatives.

O'Connor attended several schools in Dublin, including the National College of Art and Design, where she studied painting and music. However, she dropped out of school at 15 to pursue a career in music.

Music Career
-------------

### 1980s

O'Connor began performing on the streets of Dublin and in local clubs, eventually forming a band called Ton Ton Macoute. In 1984, she was discovered by Nigel Grainge, the head of Chrysalis Records, who signed her to a recording contract.

### 1987–1989: The Lion and the Cobra

O'Connor's debut album, The Lion and the Cobra, was released in 1987 to critical acclaim. The album's mix of folk, rock, and pop styles, combined with O'Connor's powerful vocals and introspective lyrics, established her as a rising star in the music industry.

### 1990–1993: I Do Not Want What I Haven't Got

O'Connor's second album, I Do Not Want What I Haven't Got, was released in 1990 and became a huge commercial success, selling over 7 million copies worldwide. The album's lead single, "Nothing Compares 2 U," a cover of a song written by Prince, became a massive hit and helped establish O'Connor as a global superstar.

#### Saturday Night Live Protest

In 1992, O'Connor appeared on Saturday Night Live, where she performed an a cappella version of Bob Marley's "War." During the performance, she held up a photograph of Pope John Paul II and tore it into pieces, sparking widespread controversy and outrage. O'Connor's actions were seen as a protest against the Catholic Church's handling of child abuse allegations and its stance on women's rights.

### 1993–2000

O'Connor's subsequent albums, including Universal Mother (1994) and Gospel Oak (1997), explored themes of motherhood, spirituality, and social justice. However, she faced declining commercial success and increasing criticism for her outspoken views and unconventional style.

### 2000s

In the 2000s, O'Connor released several albums, including Faith and Courage (2000) and Throw Down Your Arms (2005), which featured reggae-infused rhythms and socially conscious lyrics. She also became increasingly involved in activism, particularly in the area of women's rights and LGBTQ+ issues.

### 2010s

O'Connor's 2010 album, How About I Be Me (and You Be You)?, marked a return to her rock roots and featured a more introspective and personal lyrical approach. She also released several singles and EPs, including the critically acclaimed "The Vishnu Room" (2015).

### 2020–2023: Memoir and Death of Son

In 2021, O'Connor published her memoir, Rememberings, which detailed her life struggles, including her experiences with addiction, mental health issues, and her complicated relationships with her parents. Tragically, in 2023, O'Connor's 17-year-old son, Shane, died by suicide, prompting an outpouring of tributes and support from fans and fellow musicians.

Personal Life
-------------

### Marriages and Children

O'Connor has been married four times and has four children. Her first marriage, to musician John Reynolds, ended in divorce in 1995. She later married journalist Nick Sommerlad, with whom she had a son, Jake, before divorcing in 2002. O'Connor's third marriage, to musician Steve Cooney, ended in divorce in 2011. She married Irish therapist Barry Herridge in 2011, but the marriage was annulled after just 16 days.

### Other Relationships

O'Connor has been in several high-profile relationships, including with musician Peter Gabriel and actor Liam Neeson.

### Homes

O'Connor has lived in various locations, including Dublin, London, and Los Angeles. She currently resides in Ireland.

### Sexuality

O'Connor has identified as a lesbian and has been an outspoken advocate for LGBTQ+ rights.

### Politics

O'Connor has been a vocal critic of social injustice and has supported various causes, including women's rights, LGBTQ+ rights, and anti-war movements.

### Religion

O'Connor was raised Catholic but has been critical of the Church's stance on women's rights and child abuse allegations. She has explored various spiritual traditions, including Buddhism and Rastafarianism.

### Health

O'Connor has struggled with addiction and mental health issues throughout her life, including depression and bipolar disorder.

### Death

O'Connor is still active and alive.

Tributes
---------

O'Connor has been recognized for her contributions to music and social justice, including several Grammy nominations and a MTV Europe Music Award for Best Female Artist.

In Popular Culture
-------------------

O'Connor's music and style have influenced numerous artists, including Alanis Morissette, Lauryn Hill, and Regina Spektor. She has also been referenced in various films, TV shows, and literature.

article:
Sam Bankman-Fried
================

Sam Bankman-Fried is a American entrepreneur, investor, and former CEO of FTX, a cryptocurrency derivatives exchange. Born on March 6, 1992, in Stanford, California, Bankman-Fried rose to prominence in the cryptocurrency industry before facing a series of controversies and ultimately being charged with multiple crimes related to the bankruptcy of FTX.

Early life and education
------------------------

Bankman-Fried grew up in a family of academics and was raised on the Stanford University campus. His parents, Joseph Bankman and Barbara Fried, are both professors at Stanford Law School. Bankman-Fried's parents were described as "highly educated" and "strongly liberal." He has one brother, Gabe Bankman-Fried, who is also involved in politics.

Bankman-Fried attended the Crystal Springs Uplands School in Hillsborough, California, before enrolling at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) in 2010. At MIT, he studied physics and was a member of the MIT debate team. Bankman-Fried graduated from MIT in 2014 with a degree in physics.

Career
--------

After graduating from MIT, Bankman-Fried began his career as a trader at Jane Street, a quantitative trading firm. He worked at Jane Street for three years before leaving to start his own trading firm, Alameda Research, in 2017. Alameda Research was a quantitative trading firm that focused on trading cryptocurrencies and other digital assets.

In 2019, Bankman-Fried co-founded FTX, a cryptocurrency derivatives exchange. FTX quickly gained popularity and became one of the largest cryptocurrency exchanges in the world. Bankman-Fried served as the CEO of FTX until the company's bankruptcy in 2022.

Views on charity and market regulation
--------------------------------------

Bankman-Fried has been a vocal advocate for the effective altruism movement, which aims to use reason and evidence to improve the lives of others. He has stated that he intends to give away the majority of his wealth during his lifetime, and has already donated millions of dollars to various charitable causes.

Bankman-Fried has also been a vocal advocate for greater regulation of the cryptocurrency market. He has stated that he believes the market is currently under-regulated, and that greater regulation is necessary to prevent market manipulation and protect investors.

Bankruptcy of FTX
-----------------

In November 2022, FTX filed for bankruptcy and Bankman-Fried resigned as CEO. The bankruptcy was the result of a liquidity crisis, which was triggered by a series of events including the collapse of the cryptocurrency market and a run on the company's assets.

The bankruptcy of FTX was widely seen as one of the most significant events in the history of the cryptocurrency market. It led to a collapse in the value of cryptocurrencies and raised concerns about the stability of the market.

Arrest and charges
-----------------

In December 2022, Bankman-Fried was arrested in the Bahamas and charged with multiple crimes related to the bankruptcy of FTX. The charges include wire fraud, securities fraud, and money laundering.

Bankman-Fried was extradited to the United States and is currently being held in pre-trial detention. He has pleaded not guilty to all charges and is awaiting trial.

United States v. Bankman-Fried
-----------------------------

The case against Bankman-Fried is being heard in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York. The case is being prosecuted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, and is being defended by a team of lawyers led by Mark Cohen.

Trial conclusion
----------------

The trial of Bankman-Fried is ongoing, but it is expected to conclude in the coming months. If convicted, Bankman-Fried faces a maximum sentence of 115 years in prison.

Second trial dismissed
----------------------

In addition to the federal charges, Bankman-Fried was also facing a separate trial in New York state court on charges of tax evasion and other crimes. However, in January 2023, the state court judge dismissed the case, citing a lack of evidence.

Appeal
--------

Bankman-Fried's lawyers have stated that they intend to appeal the decision to dismiss the state court case. However, it is unclear whether an appeal will be successful.

Incarceration history
----------------------

Bankman-Fried is currently being held in pre-trial detention at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, New York. He has been held in solitary confinement due to concerns about his safety and the potential for him to flee the country.

Donations
---------

Bankman-Fried has been a prolific donor to charitable causes, and has given away millions of dollars to various organizations. However, some of his donations have been the subject of controversy.

Politics
---------

Bankman-Fried has been a vocal supporter of the Democratic Party, and has donated millions of dollars to Democratic candidates and causes.

2020 and earlier
----------------

In the 2020 presidential election, Bankman-Fried donated $5.2 million to the campaign of Joe Biden. He also donated millions of dollars to other Democratic candidates and causes.

2021–2022
------------

In 2021, Bankman-Fried donated $2 million to the campaign of Eric Adams, who was running for mayor of New York City. He also donated millions of dollars to other Democratic candidates and causes.

2022 U.S. midterm elections
---------------------------

In the 2022 U.S. midterm elections, Bankman-Fried donated millions of dollars to Democratic candidates and causes. However, some of his donations were the subject of controversy, with some critics accusing him of trying to buy influence in Washington.
